page.title: 17FARMING
page.content: FARMING IS STILL,HOWEVER,THE CENTRE OF LIFE IN CHEDZOY.THERE ARE NOW ONLY TWO FARMS IN THE CENTRE OF THE VILLAGE, DALTON'S AND SIBLEY'S.DALTON'S IS A BEEF FARM AND SIBLEY'S A DAIRY FARM. THE CATTLE KEPT FOR MILKING ARE ALL BRITISH FRIESIANS.BEEF CATTLE ARE OFTEN CROSSED WITH HEREFORDS OR CHAROLLAIS.THE COWS ARE MILKED TWICE A DAY.THE MILK IS STORED IN BULK TANKS AND KEPT COOL.IT IS STIRRED BY AN AUTOMATIC PADDLE TO MIX IN THE CREAM. IN SUMMER THE COWS GRAZE ON THE RICH GRASS OF SEDGEMOOR.IN WINTER THEY ARE FED SILAGE,GREEN GRASS PRESERVED BY SQUEEZING OUT THE JUICE AND KEEPING IT IN AN AIR TIGHT CLAMP,OR HAY,DRIED GRASS.NO MAIZE IS GROWN HERE NOW,THO' IT HAS BEEN TRIED.CORN,POTATOES AND MANGOLDS ARE THE OTHER MAIN CROPS. THREE FARMERS KEEP SHEEP.FARMS ARE VERY MECHANISED IN THIS AREA.
